items.title: US bars former EU commissioner Breton and others over tech rules
items.standfirst: France hits out at visa sanctions as Washington targets what it calls the ‘global censorship-industrial complex’
items.content: France hits out at visa sanctions as Washington targets what it calls the ‘global censorship-industrial complex’

items.title: US bars former EU commissioner Breton and others over tech rules
items.standfirst: France hits out at visa sanctions as Washington targets what it calls the ‘global censorship-industrial complex’
items.content: France hits out at visa sanctions as Washington targets what it calls the ‘global censorship-industrial complex’

items.title: US bars former EU commissioner, activists over alleged censorship
items.standfirst: The Trump administration on Tuesday imposed visa bans on a former European Union commissioner and anti-disinformation campaigners it says were involved in censoring US social media platforms. Trump officials have ordered US diplomats ‍to build opposition to the European Union's landmark Digital Services Act (DSA), which is intended to combat hateful speech, misinformation and disinformation, but which Washington says stifles free speech and ​imposes costs on U.S. tech companies. Story by Gabrielle Nadler.
items.content: The Trump administration on Tuesday imposed visa bans on a former European Union commissioner and anti-disinformation campaigners it says were involved in censoring US social media platforms. Trump officials have ordered US diplomats ‍to build opposition to the European Union's landmark Digital Services Act (DSA), which is intended to combat hateful speech, misinformation and disinformation, but which Washington says stifles free speech and ​imposes costs on U.S. tech companies. Story by Gabrielle Nadler.

items.title: 'Witch hunt': Ex-EU commissioner Breton denounces U.S. visa ban targeting 'censorship'
items.standfirst: The former EU commissioner and four anti-disinformation campaigners were the subject of U.S. travel sanctions.
items.content: The former EU commissioner and four anti-disinformation campaigners were the subject of U.S. travel sanctions.

items.title: US bars five Europeans over alleged efforts to ‘censor American viewpoints’
items.standfirst: US to deny visas to an ex-EU commissioner and four others it accuses of efforts to censor speech on social media.
items.content: US to deny visas to an ex-EU commissioner and four others it accuses of efforts to censor speech on social media.

items.title: Five Europeans denied US visas for combating hate speech online, accused of censoring ‘American viewpoints’
items.standfirst: The US State Department said Tuesday that it would deny visas to five Europeans, including former EU commissioner Thierry Breton, accusing them of seeking to censor "American viewpoints" online. All five are leaders in EU efforts to counter hate speech and disinformation in the digital sphere. Bréton likened the move to "McCarthy's witch hunt" in a post on X.
items.content: The US State Department said Tuesday that it would deny visas to five Europeans, including former EU commissioner Thierry Breton, accusing them of seeking to censor "American viewpoints" online. All five are leaders in EU efforts to counter hate speech and disinformation in the digital sphere. Bréton likened the move to "McCarthy's witch hunt" in a post on X.

items.title: Former EU commissioner and activists barred from US in attack on European tech regulators
items.standfirst: State department accuses group of pressuring tech firms to censor or suppress American viewpoints through regulation of disinformationThe state department has barred five Europeans from the US, accusing them of leading efforts to pressure tech firms to censor or suppress American viewpoints, in the latest attack on European regulations that target hate speech and misinformation.Secretary of state Marco Rubio said the five people targeted with visa bans – who include former European Commissioner Thierry Breton – have led “organized efforts to coerce American platforms to censor, demonetize, and suppress American viewpoints they oppose.” Continue reading...
items.content: State department accuses group of pressuring tech firms to censor or suppress American viewpoints through regulation of disinformationThe state department has barred five Europeans from the US, accusing them of leading efforts to pressure tech firms to censor or suppress American viewpoints, in the latest attack on European regulations that target hate speech and misinformation.Secretary of state Marco Rubio said the five people targeted with visa bans – who include former European Commissioner Thierry Breton – have led “organized efforts to coerce American platforms to censor, demonetize, and suppress American viewpoints they oppose.” Continue reading...

items.title: US denies visas to ex-EU commissioner and others over social media rules
items.standfirst: Thierry Breton, the former top tech regulator at the European Commission, says a "witch hunt" is taking place.
items.content: Thierry Breton, the former top tech regulator at the European Commission, says a "witch hunt" is taking place.

items.title: US Sanctions Former EU Official, Others in Swipe at Europe
items.standfirst: The Trump administration on Tuesday imposed visa sanctions on former European Union Commissioner Thierry Breton and four other people for trying to make American tech companies police political speech on their platforms.
items.content: The Trump administration on Tuesday imposed visa sanctions on former European Union Commissioner Thierry Breton and four other people for trying to make American tech companies police political speech on their platforms.

items.title: 3 die in explosion in area of Moscow where car bomb killed a general Monday
items.standfirst: Three people, including two police officers, were killed in an explosion in Moscow, Russian investigators said, days after a car bomb killed a high-ranking general not far away​.
items.content: Three people, including two police officers, were killed in an explosion in Moscow, Russian investigators said, days after a car bomb killed a high-ranking general not far away​.

items.title: Live: Two police officers killed by blast in Moscow
items.standfirst: In southern Moscow three people, including two police officers, were killed by an overnight explosion, Russian authorities said on Wednesday. Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky said a new 20-point plan, agreed on by US and Ukrainian negotiators, was being reviewed by Moscow. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.
items.content: In southern Moscow three people, including two police officers, were killed by an overnight explosion, Russian authorities said on Wednesday. Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky said a new 20-point plan, agreed on by US and Ukrainian negotiators, was being reviewed by Moscow. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.

items.title: Three killed in Moscow car explosion, say Russian authorities
items.standfirst: ‘Explosive device’ was triggered when police approached a suspicious person, say officialsTwo traffic police officers and a third person have been killed in a car explosion in Moscow, Russia’s investigative committee has said.The committee, which investigates major crimes, said in a statement on Wednesday that an explosive device had been triggered when the officers approached a “suspicious person” near their police vehicle on Yeletskaya Street in the south of the capital. Continue reading...
items.content: ‘Explosive device’ was triggered when police approached a suspicious person, say officialsTwo traffic police officers and a third person have been killed in a car explosion in Moscow, Russia’s investigative committee has said.The committee, which investigates major crimes, said in a statement on Wednesday that an explosive device had been triggered when the officers approached a “suspicious person” near their police vehicle on Yeletskaya Street in the south of the capital. Continue reading...

items.content: Investigators say the blast in Moscow occurred close to the site where a Russian general was killed on Monday.

items.title: Russian general killed by bomb under his car in Moscow
items.standfirst: A Russian general was killed after a bomb exploded under his car in Moscow. NBC News' Matt Bradley reports on how Russian investigators are looking into whether Ukrainian intelligence is possibly behind it.
items.content: A Russian general was killed after a bomb exploded under his car in Moscow. NBC News' Matt Bradley reports on how Russian investigators are looking into whether Ukrainian intelligence is possibly behind it.

items.title: Fresh Epstein files release contains multiple Trump references
items.standfirst: A new batch of Jeffrey Epstein files released Tuesday contains numerous references to President Donald Trump, including documents detailing flights he took on his then friend's private jet, and other claims that his Justice Department described as "untrue and sensationalist." Story by Camille Knight.
items.content: A new batch of Jeffrey Epstein files released Tuesday contains numerous references to President Donald Trump, including documents detailing flights he took on his then friend's private jet, and other claims that his Justice Department described as "untrue and sensationalist." items.title: Supreme Court keeps Trump’s National Guard deployment blocked in the Chicago area, for now
Supreme Court blocks Trump’s National Guard deployment in Chicago
items.standfirst: The US Supreme Court on Tuesday halted President Donald Trump’s attempt to deploy National Guard troops in Chicago, dealing a setback to his immigration crackdown and raising fresh questions about the limits of presidential authority to use the military for domestic law enforcement.
items.content: The US Supreme Court on Tuesday halted President Donald Trump’s attempt to deploy National Guard troops in Chicago, dealing a setback to his immigration crackdown and raising fresh questions about the limits of presidential authority to use the military for domestic law enforcement.

items.title: US supreme court blocks Trump bid to deploy national guard to Chicago
items.standfirst: In a 6-3 decision, the high court sided with a lower court ruling that blocked deployment of troops to the Illinois cityThe US supreme court refused on Tuesday to let Donald Trump send national guard troops to the Chicago area, in an important reining-in of the US president’s efforts to expand the use of the military for domestic purposes in historic moves against a growing number of Democratic-led jurisdictions.The nation’s highest court denied the US justice department’s request to lift a judge’s order in October that has blocked the deployment of hundreds of national guard personnel in a legal challenge brought by Illinois state officials and local leaders, who had opposed any federalization of those troops to offer backup to immigration enforcement. Continue reading...
items.content: In a 6-3 decision, the high court sided with a lower court ruling that blocked deployment of troops to the Illinois cityThe US supreme court refused on Tuesday to let Donald Trump send national guard troops to the Chicago area, in an important reining-in of the US president’s efforts to expand the use of the military for domestic purposes in historic moves against a growing number of Democratic-led jurisdictions.The nation’s highest court denied the US justice department’s request to lift a judge’s order in October that has blocked the deployment of hundreds of national guard personnel in a legal challenge brought by Illinois state officials and local leaders, who had opposed any federalization of those troops to offer backup to immigration enforcement. Continue reading...

items.title: Supreme Court says Trump can't deploy National Guard to Chicago for now

items.content: President Trump invoked a law called Title 10 to bring members of the Illinois National Guard under federal service over the objections of state and local leaders.

items.title: Libyan army chief of staff found dead in plane wreckage, PM says
items.standfirst: Libyan military chief Muhammad Ali Ahmad al Haddad and four others died in a plane crash in Turkey on Tuesday evening, Prime Minister Abdulhamid Dbeibah has confirmed. Turkey's air traffic controllers lost contact with a jet carrying the Libyan delegation that was heading home after a visit to Ankara, the Turkish interior minister said.

clusters.title: BP agrees deal to sell £7.4bn stake in Castrol to US investment firm
clusters.neutral_headline: BP agrees deal to sell £7.4bn stake in Castrol to US investment firm

items.title: BP agrees deal to sell £7.4bn stake in Castrol to US investment firm
items.standfirst: Stonepeak will acquire 65% of lubricants business as part of wider plans for the oil company to pay down its debtBusiness live – latest updatesBP has agreed to sell a majority stake in its $10bn (£7.4bn) lubricants business Castrol to the US investment firm Stonepeak, as the new chair, Albert Manifold, rapidly reshapes the under-pressure oil and gas company.Stonepeak will acquire a 65% stake in Castrol, in a deal that values the division at $10.1bn including its debt. The deal, which will see BP retain a 35% stake in the business through a joint venture, is expected to close at the end of next year, the company said on Wednesday. Continue reading...
items.content: Stonepeak will acquire 65% of lubricants business as part of wider plans for the oil company to pay down its debtBusiness live – latest updatesBP has agreed to sell a majority stake in its $10bn (£7.4bn) lubricants business Castrol to the US investment firm Stonepeak, as the new chair, Albert Manifold, rapidly reshapes the under-pressure oil and gas company.Stonepeak will acquire a 65% stake in Castrol, in a deal that values the division at $10.1bn including its debt. The deal, which will see BP retain a 35% stake in the business through a joint venture, is expected to close at the end of next year, the company said on Wednesday. Continue reading...

items.content: The Food and Drug Administration has approved a pill version of the weight-loss drug Wegovy.

items.title: FDA approves weight loss drug in daily pill form
items.standfirst: Regulators at the U.S. Food and Drug Administration gave the green light to a pill version of the blockbuster weight-loss drug Wegovy, the first daily oral medication approved to treat obesity. Dr. Jon LaPook has more.
items.content: Regulators at the U.S. Food and Drug Administration gave the green light to a pill version of the blockbuster weight-loss drug Wegovy, the first daily oral medication approved to treat obesity. Dr. Jon LaPook has more.

items.title: FDA Approves Pill Version of Wegovy
items.standfirst: Novo Nordisk’s semaglutide will soon be available in a daily pill Americans can take for weight loss.
items.content: Novo Nordisk’s semaglutide will soon be available in a daily pill Americans can take for weight loss.

clusters.title: Russian attacks kill three and cut power to freezing Ukrainian regions
clusters.neutral_headline: Russian attacks kill three and cut power to freezing Ukrainian regions

items.title: Russian attacks kill three and cut power to freezing Ukrainian regions
items.standfirst: Four-year-old child among those killed in drone and missile assault targeting energy infrastructureA massive Russian drone and missile attack on Ukraine has killed three people and cut power to several Ukrainian regions two days before Christmas and as the country enters a period of very cold weather.Russia sent more than 650 drones and more than 30 missiles into Ukraine in the attack, which began overnight and continued into Tuesday morning, local officials said. At least three people were killed, including a four-year-old child. Continue reading...
items.content: Four-year-old child among those killed in drone and missile assault targeting energy infrastructureA massive Russian drone and missile attack on Ukraine has killed three people and cut power to several Ukrainian regions two days before Christmas and as the country enters a period of very cold weather.Russia sent more than 650 drones and more than 30 missiles into Ukraine in the attack, which began overnight and continued into Tuesday morning, local officials said. At least three people were killed, including a four-year-old child. Continue reading...

items.title: Russia launches major deadly missile and drone attack on Ukraine
items.standfirst: Russia launched a major overnight missile and drone attack on Ukraine that killed at least three people - including a four-year-old child.
items.content: Russia launched a major overnight missile and drone attack on Ukraine that killed at least three people - including a four-year-old child.

clusters.title: Russia and China pledge support for Venezuela as Trump ratchets up pressure on Maduro
clusters.neutral_headline: U.S. actively pursuing sanctioned oil tanker

items.title: Russia and China pledge support for Venezuela as Trump ratchets up pressure on Maduro
items.standfirst: Trump again called for Venezuela’s president to leave power and said the US would keep or sell the oil it had seizedChina and Russia have expressed support for Venezuela as it confronts a US blockade of sanctioned oil tankers, while Donald Trump continues to ramp up his pressure campaign on the South American country’s president, Nicolás Maduro.Amid reports of slowing activity at Venezuelan ports, the US president again called for Maduro to leave power, and reiterated that the US would keep or sell the oil it had seized off the coast of Venezuela in recent weeks. Continue reading...
items.content: Trump again called for Venezuela’s president to leave power and said the US would keep or sell the oil it had seizedChina and Russia have expressed support for Venezuela as it confronts a US blockade of sanctioned oil tankers, while Donald Trump continues to ramp up his pressure campaign on the South American country’s president, Nicolás Maduro.Amid reports of slowing activity at Venezuelan ports, the US president again called for Maduro to leave power, and reiterated that the US would keep or sell the oil it had seized off the coast of Venezuela in recent weeks. Continue reading...

items.title: U.S. actively pursuing sanctioned oil tanker
items.standfirst: President Trump said the U.S. is actively pursuing a sanctioned oil tanker. It comes amid the president’s escalating pressure campaign against Venezuela. NBC News’ Garrett Haake reports.
items.content: President Trump said the U.S. is actively pursuing a sanctioned oil tanker. It comes amid the president’s escalating pressure campaign against Venezuela. NBC News’ Garrett Haake reports.
